Career information: Selected by the Los Angeles Sparks

Career highlights and awards: Honda Sports Award (1994) | 2× WNBA champion (2001, 2002) | 2× WNBA Finals MVP (2001, 2002) | 3× WNBA MVP (2001, 2004, 2006) | 8× WNBA All-Star (1999-2003, 2005, 2006, 2009) | 3× WNBA All-Star Game MVP (1999, 2001, 2002) | 8× All-WNBA First Team (1997, 2000-2004, 2006, 2008) | 4× All-WNBA Second Team (1998, 1999, 2005, 2009) | 2× WNBA Defensive Player of the Year (2004, 2008) | 2× WNBA All-Defensive First Team (2006, 2008) | 2× WNBA All-Defensive Second Team (2005, 2009) | WNBA Peak Performer (2004) | WNBA 10th Anniversary Team (2006) | WNBA 15th Anniversary Team (2011) | WNBA 20th Anniversary Team (2016) | WNBA 25th Anniversary Team (2021) | No. 9 retired by Los Angeles Sparks | No. 33 retired by USC | FIBA World Championship MVP (2002)
